0x00000000.description: Top level MSI Mask Change Status register.

0x00000008.name: PCIeVf1MsiMaskChgStat%d

0x00000004.name: MsiMaskChangeEventEn

0x00000020.description: 1-bit per VF, status of VF enable. 0=disabled, 1=enabled. VF# (23-0)
0x00000020.name: PCIeVf0Enable

0x00000024.description: 1-bit per VF, status of VF enable. 0=disabled, 1=enabled. VF# (32-1)*{{%d+1}} +23
0x00000024.name: PCIeVf1Enable%d

0x00000040.description: 1-bit per VF, status of VF bus master enable. 0=disabled, 1=enabled. VF# (23-0)
0x00000040.name: PCIeVf0BusMstrEnable

0x00000044.description: 1-bit per VF, status of VF bus master enable. 0=disabled, 1=enabled. VF# (32-1)*{{%d+1}} +23
0x00000044.name: PCIeVf1BusMstrEnable%d

0x00000060.description: Virtual/Physicaa Function Function Level Reset in progress. 0=No VF FLR in progress, 1=VF FLR in progress. PF# (0-7) VF# (8-32)
0x00000060.name: PCIeFlr0InProg

0x00000064.description: Virtual Function Function Level Reset in progress. 0=No VF FLR in progress, 1=VF FLR in progress. VF# (32-1)*{{%d+1}} +23
0x00000064.name: PCIeFlr1InProg%d

0x00000080.description: 3 bits per VF, provide current power state of the Virtual Function, 000: D0_uninitialized, 001: D0_active, 010: D1, 100: D3_hot. VF# (7-0)*{{%d+1}}
0x00000080.name: PCIeVfPwrState%d

0x000000fc.description: Indicates the activity in HAL switch, a value of zero indicates everything is idle.
0x000000fc.name: PcieHalPme

0x00000100.description: TPH Enable 1-bit per VF, TPH ST mode 3-bits per VF. VF# (7-0)*{{%d+1}}
0x00000100.name: PCIeVfTphState%d

0x0000017c.description: Reporting Requester ID and Vector number of a MSI msg aborted occurred.
0x0000017c.name: PcieIntMsiMsgAborted

0x00000180.description: Contains the state change interrupt and status
0x00000180.name: PCIeStateChangeStat

0x00000184.description: Contains MSI Req Drop status, mask and function of the request error

fields.description: Reserved
fields.name: Reserved

fields.description: Lane n3 Low Frequency (FS) value considered during TX equalization.
fields.name: LocalFs_lane_n3

fields.name: LocalFs_lane_n2

fields.description: Lane n1 Low Frequency (FS) value considered during TX equalization.
fields.name: LocalFs_lane_n1

fields.description: Lane n0 Low Frequency (FS) value considered during TX equalization.
fields.name: LocalFs1_lane_n0

fields.description: Reserved
fields.name: Reserved

fields.description: Lane n3 Low Frequency (LF) value considered during TX equalization.
fields.name: LocalLf_lane_n3

fields.description: Lane n2 Low Frequency (LF) value considered during TX equalization.
fields.name: LocalLf_lane_n2

fields.description: Lane n1 Low Frequency (LF) value considered during TX equalization.
fields.name: LocalLf_lane_n1

fields.description: Lane n0 Low Frequency (LF) value considered during TX equalization.
fields.name: LocalLf_lane_n0

fields.description: Set this bit to enable event generation for MSI mask changes.
fields.name: MsiMaskChangeEventEn

fields.description: Software must set this bit when writing to this register and before writing to the PCIeCtrlConfig1,PCIeCtrlConfig3,PCIePresetCoeff and LocalLf registers. After the PCIe parameters have been written softare should clear this bit to protect the fields from being accidentally overwritten.
fields.name: PCIeConfigWren

fields.description: Selects Serdes clock. In 2x8 Mode this bit controls the upper 8 SERDES Lane clock mux.
fields.name: PCIeSerdesClkMuxSelHi

fields.description: Selects Serdes clock. In 2x8 Mode this bit controls the low 8 SERDES Lane clock mux. In 1x16 Mode it controls all 16 Lanes.
fields.name: PCIeSerdesClkMuxSelLo

fields.description: Selects Serdes clock. In 1x16 Mode it controls the lower 8 Lanes.
fields.name: PCIeSerdesClkMuxSelX8

fields.description: Physical Function status indicates can issue Master requests
fields.name: PfBusMasterEnable

fields.description: Status of the number of active lanes.
fields.name: PCIeLanes

fields.description: Status of PCIe generation the Controller Core is configured
fields.name: GenEnable

fields.description: Software must set this bit when writing to this register and before writing to the PCIeCtrlConfig1 and PCIeCtrlConfig3 registers. After the PCIe parameters have been written softare should clear this bit to protect the fields from being accidentally overwritten.
fields.name: PCIeConfigWren

fields.description: Physical Function status indicates can issue Master requests
fields.name: PfBusMasterEnable

fields.description: Status of the number of active lanes.
fields.name: PCIeLanes

fields.description: Status of PCIe generation the Controller Core is configured
fields.name: GenEnable

fields.description: LINK0_CLIENT_REQ_EXIT_L1 input to Pcie Controller Core.
fields.name: PcieCtrlClientReqExitL1

fields.description: When in RC mode and this bit is set, the Link0 HAL switch target logic uses uses the requestor function number in place of the target function number to lookup in the HalSwitchPfVfMap the PCIe Island to steer the request to. This is meant to be used in test mode only when connecting NFPs together using a gen3x16 link.
fields.name: L0RCReqIdSwitchEna

fields.description: Set this bit to stop HAL switch from dropping master requests and target completions if the raw reset is low but pcie reset disable is stopping from resetting.
fields.name: PcieCtrlRawResetHalReqDropDisable

fields.description: LINK0_CLIENT_REQ_EXIT_L2 input to Pcie Controller Core.
fields.name: PcieCtrlClientReqExitL2

fields.description: Controls the number of tags. Must be used in conjunction with pcie_x8 tag ctrl(2b10).
fields.name: PcieCtrlHalTagCtrl

fields.description: Enables Pipe Block Align Control input to Serdes to be driven from Pcie Controller Core.
fields.name: PipeBlockAlignControlEnable

fields.description: MGMT_TYP1_REG_ACCESS input to Pcie Controller Core.
fields.name: MgmtTyp1RegAccess

fields.description: Control input to Pcie Controller Core.
fields.name: ReqPmTransitionL23Ready

fields.description: Setting this bit allows HAL Target posted requests to postpone and pass existing received non_posted requests (allowed per pcie spec). Default 0 allows HAL Target to fairly mix posted and non-posted requests.
fields.name: NonPostedOverrideDisable

fields.description: Tied to Pcie Controller CONFIG_ENABLE input. When this bit is a 0 in the EP mode, the core will generate a CRS Completion in response to Configuration Requests. In systems where the core configuration registers are loaded from RAM on power-up, this prevents the core from responding to Configuration Requests before all the registers are loaded. When this bit is a 1 in the EP mode, the core will accept Configuration Requests.
fields.name: ConfigEnable

fields.description: LINK1_CLIENT_REQ_EXIT_L1 input to Pcie Controller Core.
fields.name: PcieCtrlClientReqExitL1

fields.description: LINK0_CLIENT_REQ_EXIT_L2 input to Pcie Controller Core.
fields.name: PcieCtrlClientReqExitL2

fields.description: MGMT_TYP1_REG_ACCESS input to Pcie Controller Core.
fields.name: MgmtTyp1RegAccess

fields.description: Control input to Pcie Controller Core.
fields.name: ReqPmTransitionL23Ready

fields.description: Setting this bit allows HAL Target posted requests to postpone and pass existing received non_posted requests (allowed per pcie spec). Default 0 allows HAL Target to fairly mix posted and non-posted requests.
fields.name: NonPostedOverrideDisable

fields.description: Tied to Pcie Controller CONFIG_ENABLE input. When this bit is a 0 in the EP mode, the core will generate a CRS Completion in response to Configuration Requests. In systems where the core configuration registers are loaded from RAM on power-up, this prevents the core from responding to Configuration Requests before all the registers are loaded. When this bit is a 1 in the EP mode, the core will accept Configuration Requests.
fields.name: ConfigEnable

fields.description: Pcie Controller Core status of 16-bit output data from the debug bus.
fields.name: PCIeCntrlrDebugData

fields.description: Reflects current state of the Hot Reset Status from the PCIe Controller. If set a hot reset was received from the link in the Endpoint mode.
fields.name: HotResetStat

fields.description: SW sets this bit when Pcie Controller Core needs to initiate a Hot Reset sequence on the PCIe link when in RC mode.
fields.name: HotResetInit

fields.description: Pcie Controller Core status asserted when its LTSSM detects a link-down event (when the LINK_UP state variable goes to 0).
fields.name: LinkDownResetOut

fields.description: PCIe Core output used in RC mode to signal a link training related event has occurred
fields.name: PhyInterrupt

fields.description:
Pcie Controller Core status. Used to signal an error or abnormal condition to the local processor. 
The interrupting condition can be obtained by reading the Local Error Status Register.
fields.name: LocalInterrupt

fields.description: Pcie core detected a fatal error.
fields.name: FatalError

fields.description: Pcie core detected a non-fatal error.
fields.name: NonFatalError

fields.description: Pcie core detected a correctable error.
fields.name: CorrectableError

fields.description: Software writes a 1 to this bit when an correctable error has been detected. A correctable error can be a correctable error event from the Shared SRAM. The error is reported by the core through the PCI Express Advanced Error Reporting mechanism.
fields.name: CorrectableErrorIn

fields.description: Software writes a 1 to this bit when an uncorrectable error has been detected. An uncorrectable error can be an uncorrectable error event from the Shared SRAM or a DMA Descriptor Rd Parity error. The error is reported by the core through the PCI Express Advanced Error Reporting mechanism.
fields.name: UncorrectableErrorIn

fields.description: Software sets this bit to mask the interrupt.
fields.name: IntAMask

fields.description: Software sets this bit to mask the interrupt.
fields.name: IntBMask

fields.description: Software sets this bit to mask the interrupt.
fields.name: IntCMask

fields.description: Software sets this bit to mask the interrupt.
fields.name: IntDMask

fields.description: Legacy Interrupt driven by the PCIe Core
fields.name: IntA

fields.description: Legacy Interrupt driven by the PCIe Core
fields.name: IntB

fields.description: Legacy Interrupt driven by the PCIe Core
fields.name: IntC

fields.description: Legacy Interrupt driven by the PCIe Core
fields.name: IntD

fields.description: Controls masking off evalutating known bad TX Presets during link equalization
fields.name: PresetSweepMask

fields.description: Controls bypassing the evaluation of the remote PHY Tx during Link Equalization
fields.name: BypassRemoteTxEq

fields.description: When in RC mode, controls Phase 2 and phase 3 of Link Equalization
fields.name: BypassPhase23

fields.description: Selects which interrupt pin legacy interrupts are mapped to.
fields.name: InterruptOutSelectPF7

fields.description: Selects which interrupt pin legacy interrupts are mapped to.
fields.name: InterruptOutSelectPF6

fields.description: Selects which interrupt pin legacy interrupts are mapped to.
fields.name: InterruptOutSelectPF5

fields.description: Selects which interrupt pin legacy interrupts are mapped to.
fields.name: InterruptOutSelectPF4

fields.description: Selects which interrupt pin legacy interrupts are mapped to.
fields.name: InterruptOutSelectPF3

fields.description: Selects which interrupt pin legacy interrupts are mapped to.
fields.name: InterruptOutSelectPF2

fields.description: Selects which interrupt pin legacy interrupts are mapped to.
fields.name: InterruptOutSelectPF1

fields.description: Selects which interrupt pin legacy interrupts are mapped to.
fields.name: InterruptOutSelectPF0

fields.description: Indicates Pcie Controller Core status of Read Completion Boundary setting: 0 = 64B, 1 = 128B
fields.name: RcbStatus

fields.description: Reflects Pcie Controller Core status of current operating speed of the link (00 = 2.5 GT/s, 01 = 5 GT/s, 10 = 8 GT/s). Valid when LINK_STATUS = 10 or 11.
fields.name: NegotiatedSpeed

fields.description:
Indicates Pcie Controller Core status of the limit of the size of outgoing read requests. The 3-bit codes are the same as those defined in PCIe Specifications:
000 = 128 bytes,
001 = 256 bytes,
010 = 512 bytes,
011 = 1024 bytes,
100 = 2048 bytes
101 = 4096 bytes.
fields.name: MaxReadReqSize

fields.description:
Reflects Pcie Controller Core status of the limit of  the size of Outgoing Completion payloads. The 3-bit codes are the same as those defined in PCIe Specifications:
000 = 128 bytes,
001 = 256 bytes,
010 = 512 bytes.
fields.name: MaxPayloadSize

fields.description:
Reflects Pcie Controller Core power state of the PCIe link.
0001 = L0,
0010 = L0s,
0100 = L1,
1000 = L2.
fields.name: LinkPowerState

fields.description:
Indicates Pcie Controller Core status of the PCI Express link.
00 = No receivers detected,
01 = Link training in progress,
10 = Link up , DL initialization in progress,
11 = Link up, DL initialization completed..
fields.name: LinkStatus

fields.description: Reflects Pcie Controller Core state of the Link Training and Status State Machine.
fields.name: LtssmState

fields.description: Programmable Vendor Specific Capability Registers
fields.name: PCIeVendorSpecificCapabilityReg

fields.description: This bit indicates that the MSI recieved went down as legacy and was dropped due to INTx disable.
fields.name: IsLegacy

fields.description: Set this bit to mask event generation when an MSI Request Error is detected. Clear this bit to enable MSI Request Error event generation.
fields.name: MSIReqErrorMask

fields.description: This bit is set when a VF MSI Interrupt is received from the attached PCIe Island for a function that is masked for MSI
fields.name: MSIReqError

fields.description: Function number associated with the MSIReqError
fields.name: MSIFunction

fields.description: PF MSI Mask Change status for PF 0-7. A set bit indicates there was a write to the PF MSI Mask register associated with a Physical Function
fields.name: MsiMaskChgStat

fields.description: Used by software to indicate which of the eight PCIeVfMsiMaskChgStat registers contains a set bit. Bit 0 equals the logical 'or' of the PCIeVfMsiMaskChgStat0 register. Bit 1 equals the logical 'or' of the PCIeVfMsiMaskChgStat1 register.
fields.name: VfMsiMaskChgTopStat

fields.description:
Provides Pcie Controller Core status of the current power state of the Physical Functions. There are 3-bits per physical function where bits [2:0] are PF0s function power state and bits [23:21] are PF7s function power state. The possible power states are:
000: D0_uninitialized,
001: D0_active,
010: D1,
100: D3_hot.
fields.name: FunctionPowerState

fields.description:
Indicates Pcie Controller Core status of the states of the Command Register bits in the PCI configuration space of each Function. There are 4-bits per physical function where bits [3:0] are PF0s functional status and bits [31:28] are PF7s functional status. These outputs are used to enable requests and completions from the host logic. The assignment of bits is as follows:
Bit 0: Function 0 IO Space Enable,
Bit 1: Function 0 Memory Space Enable,
Bit 2: Function 0 Bus Master Enable,
Bit 3: Function 0 INTx Disable.
fields.name: FunctionStatus

fields.description: Interrupt status bit that indicates the HOT_RESET_OUT from the PCIe core has asserted. Current state of the signal can be read in the PCIeCntrlrConfig2 register.

fields.description: Interrupt status bit that indicates there was a change to the FUNCTION_POWER_STATE or VF_POWER_STATE status from the PCIe core. Writing a 1 to this register asserts the POWER_STATE_CHANGE_ACK back to the PCIe Core.

fields.description: SRAM0: Bias Level Adjust Input. This is bias control for controlling the diode connected to VSSCORE.

fields.description: SRAM0: Bias Level Adjust Input. This is bias control for controlling the diode connected to VSSCORE.
fields.name: BC1_0

fields.description: SRAM0: Test pin for Port B to bypass self-timed circuit. The external clock controls the read and write control signals.

fields.description: SRAM0: Test pin for Port A to bypass self-timed circuit. The external clock controls the read and write control signals.
fields.name: Test1Test1A0

fields.description: SRAM0: Enables the override of the sense-amp controls by both RmRma0 and Rmb0 fields.
fields.name: RaRmOveride0

fields.description: SRAM0: RA for 1-Port SRAMs. Read Assist(RA) to control WL under-drive. See SRAMs specs.
fields.name: Ra0

fields.description: SRAM0: RMB for 2-port SRAMs. Read Margin Port B(RMB) sets the Read-Write margin by adjusting the sense amp differential setting.  See SRAMs specs.
fields.name: Rmb0

fields.description: SRAM0: RM for 1-Port SRAMs / RMA for 2-port SRAMs. Read Margin(RM) / Read Margin Port A(RMA) sets the Read-Write margin by adjusting the sense amp differential setting.  See SRAMs specs.
fields.name: RmRma0

fields.description: Read page address to serdes membus
fields.name: SerDesRdPageAddr

fields.description: Read offset Address to serdes membus
fields.name: SerDesRdOffsetAddr

fields.description: Set to '1' when read complete, cleared when next read initiated
fields.name: SerDesRdDataValid

fields.description: 8 bit read data from SerDes
fields.name: SerDesRdData

fields.description: Read/Write page address to serdes membus
fields.name: SerDesPageAddr

fields.description: Write to 1 to select PCS Registers. Write to 0 to select PMA registers. PageAddr and OffsetAddr bits will index into the PCS or PMA register sets depending on the state of this bit.
fields.name: SerDesPcsPmaSel

fields.description: Read/Write offset Address to serdes membus
fields.name: SerDesOffsetAddr

fields.description: Reserved for Use.
fields.name: Rfu

fields.description: write to 1 to start read op. Self clears when read complete. read data in corresponding read register. If read and write bits set at same time, operation default to NOP.
fields.name: SerDesRdBusy

fields.description: write to 1 to start write op. Self clears when write complete.
fields.name: SerDesWrBusy

fields.description: 8 bit write data to SerDes. Dont care for a read op.
fields.name: SerDesWrData
